item.title: Report E-2023090080
item.description:
Report E-2023090080

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: EAST NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, four (4) 90-pound boxes of UN2491 were torn and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools and a neutralizing agent to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and the damaged containers of product were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023080826
item.description:
Report X-2023080826

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS, THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO HANDLE THE REPACKING PROCESS. DescribePack: THERE WERE FOUR BOTTLES INSIDE THE PACKAGE. ONE OF THOSE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP ON IT WHICH THEN CAUSED IT TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE OTHER 3 REMAINING BOTTLES AND ALSO CAUSING THE PACKAGE ITSELF TO BE WET. APPROXIMATELY 2 CUPS OF LIQUID LEAKED OUT OF THAT ONE BOTTLE. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: AFTER THE MANAGER SECURED AND VENTILATED THE PACKAGE I WAS CALLED OVER. I PROCEEDED TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM PROPERLY AND SECURELY. AFTER IT WAS DONE BEING REPACKED I AM WAITING FOR THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH.

item.title: Report X-2023080814
item.description:
Report X-2023080814

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon inspection, there are four 4-liter glass bottles of Acetonitrile inside a fiberboard box. One of the glass bottles shattered causing the liquid to leak throughout the box. The box shows wet stains from the leakage. DescribePack: One of the 4-liter glass bottles shattered. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: shattered glass was placed in a hazardous material plastic bag.

item.title: Report X-2023080788
item.description:
Report X-2023080788

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the box arrived at the hazmat cage with wet conditions. Upon inspection, the package with1 of 4 bottles containing "Advantage chemicals oven & grill cleaner" was discovered to have a loose cap. Package was placed into a salvage drum to be returned to the shipper unless otherwise. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a loose cap on 1 out of 4 of the plastic bottles. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately tightened and placed into a salvage drum to await disposition.

item.title: Report E-2023080867
item.description:
Report E-2023080867

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the poly 55 gallon drum of monomer (un3265) releasing 2 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
